AD.name: Projection
AD.description: Mercator is a standard entire-globe projection (though it distorts the size and shape of large objects, especially near the poles). Albers, which preserves area, and Lambert, which preserves angles (or shapes) are recommended for state maps

AD.name: Color by
AD.description: Numeric attribute that determines region color

AD.name: Color scaling
AD.description: How to scale the color attribute (linear implies no rescaling)

AD.name: Color range
AD.description: Two colors that the region colors should range between, from least to greatest

AD.name: Latitude
AD.description: Numeric attribute that determines circle latitude (ranges from -180 (180 degrees west) to +180 (180 degrees east)

AD.name: Longitude
AD.description: Numeric attribute that determines circle longitude (ranges from -90 (90 degrees south) to +90 (90 degrees north)

AD.name: Size circles by
AD.description: Numeric attribute that determines circle size (that is, area)

AD.name: Size scaling
AD.description: How to scale the size attribute (linear implies no rescaling)

AD.name: Color Scaling
